value.title: Install and configure Power BI Report Server (May 2017 Preview)
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how to install and configure the May 2017 Preview of Power BI Report Server. Power BI Report Server has a new standalone install experience and this product allows for Power BI reports to be rendered in the web portal along with paginated reports.  This will get you started with

value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Per User (Preview)
value.excerpt: Are you curious what Power BI Premium Per User is all about? Adam walks you through how to get it and what it means from a user experience. Take advantage of Power BI Premium features without the Premium capacity price!  Announcement Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-premium-per-user-public-preview-now-available/

value.excerpt: Take Power BI Conditional Drill to the next level by incorporating Paginated reports with your strategy! Patrick shows a customer scenario that he solved using this approach. value.title: Make your Power BI mobile reports POP
value.excerpt: You wanted better control over your Power BI Mobile Report layouts? Look no further. Michal Heldy joins us to walk us through how to get the most out of this new enhancement in Power BI Desktop!  Connect with Michal Foster Heldy https://www.linkedin.com/in/michal-foster-heldy-70870b13/ https://twitter.com/Michal36040600

value.title: Migrate your Paginated reports to Power BI
value.excerpt: Are your paginated reports still on-premises with either Power BI Report Server or SQL Server Reporting Services? Want to move them to Power BI? Patrick shows you how you can do that using the RDLMigration tool!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/migrate-ssrs-reports-to-power-bi

value.title: Natives Queries or ODBC with Incremental Refresh in Power BI
value.excerpt: Are you wanting to use Incremental Refresh in Power BI but need to use ODBC, native queries or something that doesn't fold properly? Adam shows you a solution for Power BI Desktop and Power BI dataflows!  Native Queries https://docs.microsoft.com/power-query/native-database-query  Using Incremental Refresh

value.title: Power BI and the On-premises Data Gateway: What is it?
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at the On-Premises Data Gateway. What is it exactly? This can be used with more than just Power BI. This includes PowerApps, Microsoft Flow, Azure Analysis Services and more. The entire Power Platform!   If you found this video helpful, we have a free cheat sheet for you for more

value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can use Power BI Apps as a consumer of dashboards and reports. value.title: Power BI dataflows: One thing you probably missed with your gateway

value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters

value.title: Power BI URL Filter Updates (August 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the recent updates to using the Power BI URL Filter. The update to using URL Filter parameters in Power BI include updates to operators along with the ability to use more than strings and spaces in table names!
